intro: Ophrys attaviria, commonly known as the Attawapiskat orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to the boreal forests of Canada. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which mimics the appearance of female wasps to attract male pollinators through a process called pseudocopulation. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with intricate patterns that enhance its mimicry. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Ophrys attaviria is considered a vulnerable species.
